alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:47PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Boulder County through 615 PM MDT... At 547 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jamestown, or 36 miles southwest of Fort Collins, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jamestown, Gold Hill, Raymond and Allenspark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
